item.title: Anti-skid System Channels – (One Channel And Associated Brake Inoperative – DEACTIVATED BY SPECIAL BRAKE TOOL)

remarks.para: One channel and associated brake may be inoperative (brake deactivated or line capped) provided:

numlitem.para: Brake is deactivated by an acceptable procedure, and
AOM Ch. 5.1 Brake Deactivated or Line Capped decrements are applied for the selected procedure.

note.para: Dispatch is not allowed with a brake deactivated and the anti-skid system inoperative.

operation.para: (Use appropriate One Brake Deactivated worksheet respective to engine type, in Chapter 5.1 of the AOM.)

numlitem.para: See the destination airport landing chart for the runway limit weight for landing with one wheel brake deactivated.

note.para: Reduce the Quick Turn Around Limit Weight for Landing (corrected for wind and runway slope) by 14,500 lbs. (PW) for flaps 40, and 14,900 lbs. (RR) for Flaps 30 and 15,100 (RR) for Flaps 25. If corrected maximum Quick Turn Around Limit Weight is exceeded, wait at least 45 minutes and check that the wheel thermal plugs have not melted before executing a takeoff.

numlitem.para: Land and Hold Short Operations (LAHSO) prohibited.

note.para: Must be operative for dispatch into LPB, UIO, BOG, GUA, TGU.

numlitem.para: Downgrade aircraft category dispatch status to CAT 3a.
Runway Limit Weight reduced by 9,000 lbs. for Flaps 15 or Flaps 20.
Landing Weight Reduction – see destination airport landing chart for Max Landing Weight With One Brake Deactivated.
Flaps 1 and Flaps 5 takeoff operation is not allowed.
Land and Hold Short Operations (LAHSO) prohibited.

placard.para: Placard ANTI-SKID light "ANTI-SKID SYSTEM CHANNEL # ______ INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: There are eight anti-skid channels in the normal anti-skid system. "Channel" refers to the anti-skid function for an individual brake.

numlitem.para: Accomplish DMP 32-41-1-1 if deactivating brake by using special brake tool.
Accomplish DMP 32-41-1-2 if deactivating brake by capping brake line.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.
